The rooms were comfy, the service was good ( they even got us extra keys when we were locked out at 1am) it's right across from the beach and walking distance to downtown. It's super affordable too. No it's not ocean front on the beach. No it's not the most romantic place in Laguna. But, if you don't plan on spending all day in your room gazing out at your ocean view... It really is perfect!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your feedback. My staff and I value all the feedback we receive and want to thank you for your kind words. We hare happy to hear that you had a great time while staying at our hotel and hope that you can come back and visit us again. May you have a wonderful day. Kind Regards, Management

Summary: My wife and I have spent many vacations around the world at Holiday Inns but none like the Holiday Inn in Laguna Beach. Within easy walking distance of town,  This Holiday Inn had real charm and  reminds me of a bygone era. Highly recommend this Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, My staff and I would like to thank you for your kind words. It's encouraging to hear that everyone's hard work is paying off and making our guests happy with the hotel.  We do hope you can come back and  visit us again soon.  Thank You have a wonderful day.

Summary Heading: Be Sure You Know What You're Getting...
Summary: If you do not mind an older, clean, dark room while in Laguna Beach, then maybe this Holiday Inn will fit your needs. But just know exactly what you are getting. The room is dark due to the drapes needing to be closed if you want privacy. Each room has a pool view which other guests walk by daily.   There is a window ac unit which is loud and the room has a feeling of stuffiness and being dated.  The location of the hotel is good, but the rooms have neither an ocean view nor any feel of being in a beach area. As a matter of fact, there is no enticement for staying in your room beyond basic sleeping needs.  Again, it depends on your sense of value for the dollar. My friend and I would definitely spend a little more for an ocean view hotel in Laguna Beach with more of a vacation
Manager Response: Dear Cindy S,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I can assure you that your comfort and satisfaction are of utmost importance to us and for that please accept my sincere apologies if your stay was negatively affected by the service you received from our hotel. I appreciate you bringing this matter into our attention as this is our best resource for improving guest satisfaction. I have taken note of your valuable comments and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of services we offer to our guests.  Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We always stay at Holiday Inns when we travel as a family as the value, locations and accomodations are always good.  But every once in awhile you get an added bonus.  Not only was the location perfect, the hotel itself was beautiful.  It had a lovely courtyard with beautiful flowers and a pool.  It was really quite striking.  In addition the on site restaurant was excellent and would recomend both!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, My staff and I are very happy to hear that you had a wonderful time here at our hotel. Your feedback just encourages my staff and I to continue providing great customer service to each of our guests. We hope that you are having a wonderful day and that you can come visit us again soon, Thank you.

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The hotel has a great location. The room was very clean and quiet.  The front desk staff is outstanding.  They were always friendly, accommodating, and asking if they could do anything for us.  One evening I was having a problem accessing my email to print some ticket and the woman at the desk was extremely helpful.  We will certainly stay here again when in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us while visiting Laguna Beach. My staff and I always strive to provide the best service we can to our guests and are happy to hear that you had a great experience. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you

Summary: Boutique Holiday Inn hotel in Laguna Beach. Five minutes from the beach and right on the Main Street thru Laguna Beach. Ralph's is across the road for any supplies. Take a room on level 1, e.g. 53. Accommodating staff at the front desk. Good clean hotel and quiet location. Will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, My staff and I would like to thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is always encouraging to our staff to know that we delivered great services to our guests. We do hope you visit us again soon and have a wonderful day. Thank you.

Summary: Stay away from this hotel.  We have happily booked many reservations through a leading online service I will call "ABC"  I don't want to mention here (not their fault!) but this was first time we felt outright penalized for our reservation.   We were offered  a tiny, dark room at end of nearly windowless tunnel despite fact other better rooms were obviously available.  Room was so small it was impossible to even fold down roll away bed despite this being a reservation that accommodates five guests.    When we complained they said "You booked ABC.com" then suggested we place mattress on the stained carpeted floor not an option for our asthmatic son.  Front desk staff was rude. This is an overpriced, seriously outdated property in a great location. Holiday Inn should drop this
Manager Response: Dear Suitcase_Sherpa,   Thank you very much for sharing your experience with us. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for.  I am very disappointed to hear about your experience. I want to assure you that our hotel is very proud of its level of service and quality of its product and as such, I apologize if we fell below your standards with regard to the room condition and if the level of service provided didn't meet your expectations.  It is only through valuable feedback we receive from our valued customers that we would be in a position to know where we go wrong and rectify the circumstances or incidents, in order to ensure that we do not repeat the same in the future. I assure you that we take every comment seriously and your review will be used to reconsider improvements needed and I hope that you can give us a chance to show what we have done.  Sincerely,   Dhan M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We arrived in the evening and the pool area was all lit up with twinkly lights - it really was breathtaking. The rooms themselves are a little tired but very clean and comfortable. There is a really good restaurant under the hotel that also plays some very cool music, including live jazz on a Sunday. The pool is lovely to sit by too. You couldn't really beat the location - just minutes away from the shops, restaurants and the beach. As per most hotels in the USA, we had to pay for parking but, to be fair, it is in the middle of a very busy resort and parking is prime. The staff were very friendly and helpful too. We booked on-line and therefore got a much better rate than had we just turned up. We would happily recommend this to anybody who is considering visiting Laguna. Make
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We appreciate your feedback so that we can continue to grow and provide great service to our guests. We are happy to inform that we will be updating the rooms soon and we hope that you can come back when they are finished. May you have a wonderful day and we hope to see you soon. Kind Regards

Summary Heading: It's outdated and ok for a place to crash due to location
Summary: Holiday Inn needs to offer free parking if you stay here and should always have someone carry bags since there is not a much needed elevator. This would be a somewhat acceptable offset to the loud window units, flickering lights and outdated decor.   It's situated in a great spot to walk the strip and the showers have been nicely updated, they are huge walkins
Manager Response: Dear BBelenchia,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate that you find our location to be convenient.  However, We‚Äôre sorry we fell below your expectation regarding parking arrangement, noise and customer service. We will address these points.  I assure you the feedback of our hotel will be reviewed and most certainly forwarded to the appropriate departments. We take  the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences.  We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed for two nights at this hotel for my birthday.  The bed was comfortable and the location is great!  The pool area is relaxing and I love all of the flowers all around.  All of the employees are friendly.  The restaurant there on location also has some great food and the bartender makes a wonderful Mojito and I don't even like them but I tried my boyfriend's and had to order a couple myself.  Even though the price is high (but I guess it is everywhere down there) I would stay here again.  The only complaint I have is that on Sunday morning around 7 am someone was washing something with a hose for almost an hour and kept hitting the window by our room as we were on the corner and it would have been nice to be able to sleep in that day.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, My staff and I would like to thank you for your feedback. It is great to hear that our guests enjoyed our service and the hotel. I am also happy to say that our hotel is in the process of updating the rooms and hope that you visit us in the near future so you can see what we will have accomplished. Hope all is well and that you have a wonderful day. Kind regards.

Summary: We arrived very late after a lot of traffic from LA and realised we had booked the wrong nights. Instead of being difficult Sabinha the night receptionist was more than accommodating and found us rooms at the agreed price.  We'd stayed here 18 years ago and had loved it so came back with our kids.  It's now very tired and old fashioned. However it's still very pretty with the rooms surrounding the pool. It's surprisingly protected from traffic noise with comfortable beds.  It's not chic or upmarket just a conveniently located, well priced, place to crash for a night or two.  The restaurant below the hotel was worth visiting. Laguna itself can't be missed, the beaches, shops,art galleries make this a MUST, we'd really wished we'd stayed longer.  Its very cool place with some
Manager Response: Dear Yvonne016,  Thank you very much for taking the time to share your comments online. Please accept my apologies for falling short of your expectations on some aspects of your stay. However, we are thankful that you enjoyed your stay despite some issues. I appreciate your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services. We all hope that we will have the opportunity to host you again on a future visit.  Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed here for 1 night.  Its on the pacific highway but we didn't here much traffic noise though this could have been due to the noisy air con!! I felt our room was a bit tired looking but it was clean and absolutely fine for 1 night.  It's in a good location, just a short walk to the resort centre or to the beach.  The reception staff were very helpful, we liked the fact there was always water, coffee and soft drinks available in the lobby.   Laguna Beach is a beautiful place to visit, we loved it here.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We are so happy to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us here at the hotel. Our staff is pleased to know that they are doing a good job. We do hope that you visit us again soon and that you have a wonderful day.

Summary: So my experience here was a bit different. I did not stay a night at the hotel. I went to spend a day to Laguna with my boyfriend and got badly food intoxicated. While walking on the street feeling awful and throwing up in every place possible, I thought that I couldn't take it more. I couldn't kept walking so I decided that maybe we needed to stay the night there. I just wanted to lay down. Oh and I have no US phone, so I couldn't call anyone to come and get us. We came in at the Holiday Inn and the receptionist lady told us that they were full. She was beyond nice to us. She let me stayed at the lobby so I could rest, offered us their costumer complimentary drinks and to use their computer. That way we could got a hold of somebody to come pick us up. I'm sincerely deeply
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We are happy to hear that our staff was able to offer wonderful customer service to you even though you where not staying with us. We hope you can one day stay with us and are happy to hear that everything worked out. Have a wonderful day and hope to see you soon.

Summary: We booked this hotel the night before our visit.  Since we wanted a Saturday night, we were so happy to get a room on PCH, that we paid more than we wanted.  The room was $315.00/night.  When we got there, I looked at the website on Saturday, the rooms were going for $246.00.  Many of the rooms were not occupied as of 10:00 pm, since they leave the drapes wide open if not occupied.  The location was perfect, and easy walking everywhere.  The hotel is a bit dated, and reminded us of a boutique hotel because of the size of the property.  The restaurant food was very good, but the atmosphere inside was disappointing (music too loud, too modern, not warm).  Overall, if we wanted to stay in Laguna Beach for a reasonably priced room, we would go back again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you soon. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: Hubby planned our 2 night stay through "Priceline".  We were familiar with the location & that was a big draw for us, we wanted to be able to walk everywhere. The hotel is ideal for that. We never saw our car again until we checked out!  The Courtyard is very tropical feeling with a twist of retro, I couldn't help getting that 60's beach vibe from it. The room was spacious for two, great dressing area, updated as much as possible for a small older hotel & the staff were all friendly.  We ended one of our two nights there at the Bar inside the MARE restaurant & were very impressed with how high end the interior was designed & decorated. We noticed that the dining area was always full when we stepped into the hotel for something during the day/early early evenings.  The bar staff
Manager Response: Dear Guest,       We are happy to hear that you were satisfied with your stay at our hotel. Thank you for the kind feedback. We are currently in the process of updating our rooms so we do hope that you come back and visit us to see our new fresh look. We hope you have a great day and you'll visit us soon, thank you.

Summary: It is difficult to find a nice hotel in Laguna that is this close to the beach at a price that is affordable.  All of the employees at the hotel were friendly, the rooms were nice, and the grounds were attractive with beautiful flowers and plants.  Having a Ralph's grocery store directly across the street was convenient.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples, individuals and families visiting the area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,      Thank you for choosing our hotel to stay at here in Laguna Beach. Our staff was happy to hear that you were satisfied with your stay and we hope that you visit us again soon. May you have a wonderful day.

Summary Heading: Like it but had a few issues
Summary: My family of three stayed here in mid-June for five days. We had a room with two double beds on the second floor. Overall, I have no major complaints. The beds were extremely comfortable, with nice sheets and pillows. The shower was updated and huge. The tv had a perfect picture and the fridge worked great. The courtyard was beautiful and we enjoyed the pool with its comfortable lounge chairs and gazebos. The main lobby always had Pepsi, Diet Pepsi, bottled water and hot water. It usually, but not always, had popcorn. There was a small desk right by the refreshments with a computer and printer. Across the side street, Cleo, was a very nice Ralph's grocery store where we stocked up on pop, snacks and a few souvenirs.  The Orange Inn, across the PCH, had extremely tasty food but
Manager Response: Dear Guest,     We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us but we would also like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced. We do hope you can come visit us again for an even better experience. We appreciate your feedback and hope you have a wonderful day, thank you.

Summary Heading: Airless rooms with sealed windows and outdated window units
Summary: This facility features tiny rooms with sealed windows and an outdated, noisy air conditioning unit, scratched furniture, and all rooms located around a pool with lots of loud children. It's like a motel designed 50 years ago, which this likely was. To get privacy, you must pull the blackout curtains, resulting in a dark, airless, tiny, claustrophobic room. For twice the price (worth it!) you can go to a place like Surf and Sand, get an elegant room, and be on the beach instead of across the street right on noisy Pacific Coast Highway.  The parking lot is small, difficult to maneuver, and was oversold. Upon returning at 11:30 p.m., there was no place to park. it took 45 minutes of extensive negotiating with the grumpy night manager before he agreed to move his car. After he did
Manager Response: Dear VittorioK,  Thank you for taking the time to relay your comments regarding our property during your recent stay. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. I sincerely apologize that your stay with us was not up to your standards. We have taken note of your valuable comments and have shared these with our management team for the purpose of bringing improvements needed.  Thank you for staying with us, and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you again.  Sincerely,   Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Pre booked this hotel for 7 nights as part of a surfing vacation for me and my teenage son and was not disappointed. The location is fantastic with a suitable surfers beach only one block away. We arrived at the hotel early and found the staff both friendly and accommodating. The hotel offers free refreshments for all guests and as I was staying for 7 nights the parking fee was waived, which was an unexpected bonus. The rooms although compact were clean and comfortable and fitted with a fridge. A microwave was available for use if required. The hotel was within easy walking distance of the shops and restaurants of Laguna with a Ralph's supermarket across the road. During our stay nothing was too much trouble for the staff making my stay an extremely enjoyable experience. A late
Manager Response: Dear Guest, My staff and I would like to thank you for your kind words. We always do our best to give great customer service and are happy to hear that you had a wonderful time with us. We hope you visit us again in Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: Obviously this hotel was originally built as a different property with a Spanish feel to it. The grounds are impeccably landscaped and the courtyard pool is a welcome retreat. Great location, on PCH, across from Ralph's market.   The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  While the room appeared a bit tired, it was quiet and comfortable.  Lobby amenities included coffee, tea, decaf, pop, ice water and popcorn.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,    My staff and I are happy to hear that you had a good time at our property in Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. We are open to looking on ways of improving our customer service so we appreciate your feedback. We hope you will join us again in the near future. Thank you, have a wonderful day.

Summary: We stayed here last week as part of our vacation to Southern California.  I was able to easily book two nights using reward points through their website.  When we arrived, our room wasn't ready yet but it was early.  The staff was friendly and offered water and refreshments and we left to find lunch.  Afterward, the room was ready, we were kindly upgraded to a suite, and checking in was a breeze.  The suite was great!  It had a large bed and bath with jacuzzi tub as well as a separate living area with a TV and fireplace.  The only detractor was that the interior was showing its age a bit.  Other than that, the courtyard pool was clean, and the restaurant downstairs was amazing.  I'd recommend this hotel to those on a couples vacation or traveling with friends.  I also recommend
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I would like to thank you for choosing out hotel to stay at during your vacation. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are always open to hearing on ways that we can improve our rooms so thank you for your feedback. My staff and I hope you stay with us again in the near future. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: We stayed here one night on our way down to San Diego. The hotel is cute. The location makes it a perfect place to walk around Laguna, so it really doesn't need a lot of amenities - but it still did great. It took is a long time to check in. There were 2 couples from Texas who took forever to check in, there was some sort of problem and they were being extremely vocal. We waited it out and the staff was fine with us, displaying no attitude or stress. You can always count on this chain, from my experience.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, On behalf of my staff and I we would like to thank you for your kind words. We are happy to hear that you had a good time here at our property. We hope you visit us again soon. Have a wonderful day thank you.

Summary Heading: Nice break after three jam-packed days at Disneyland Resort
Summary: After an enjoyable yet intense three days at Disneyland Resort, we drove down the coast to Laguna Beach for a relaxing two night stay.  This is a really cute hotel, with most, if not all, of the rooms surrounding an interior courtyard with a pool, which we used quite a bit (pretty sure it is heated as well).  The staff were really friendly as well.  Access to the beach is pretty convenient as well as you just need to cross the street and head down some stairs (however, the traffic lights are really slow to change).  Breakfast is not included, but there is an onsite restaurant (which we did not try) and a grocery store across the street.  And of course, Laguna Beach is just full of restaurants catering to different tastes and budgets.  There is also a small snack table in the
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for choosing our hotel to relax and enjoy the city of Laguna Beach. We are pleased to hear that you had a good time and hope that you join us again in the near future. Have a wonderful day.

Summary Heading: Awesome place to spend Mother's Day weekend!
Summary: This hotel is such a great place to stay in Laguna Beach!  Michael and Karen were so great to work with. The room was very clean and the pool was aeesome!  They made my mother's day weekend the best one yet!  Thank you!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,             Thank you for staying with us at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. We are thrilled to hear you had a    wonderful time and a great Mothers day. We hope you join us again soon. On behalf of all us at Holiday Inn we hope you have a wonderful day.

Summary: We stayed here in June 2012 with our two children ages 8 and 10.  From the photos, the hotel looks beautiful, especially the pool.  While it was fairly nice, but some areas around the pool were not clean at all.  Our room was decent, but we were on the bottom floor near the corner of the pool.  There always seemed to be large bins of towels and cleaning equipment that we had to dodge to get in our room.  The hotel staff was very helpful.  Given that this is a holiday inn, we thought it would be good for families.  I must say that we did feel a bit uncomfortable with our kids there, particularly in the pool.  There seemed to be no other children while we were there and the "tenor" around the pool did not lend itself well for kids wanting to splash around in the pool.  So, there
Manager Response: Dear Guest,           Thank you for staying at our hotel. We always try to provide a family environment as most of our clientele are families on vacation. We do hope that you come back and give us another chance for a better experience. Take care and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel, but its near the beach
Summary: the hotel is Ok, not the best, the heater stopped working and they gave me a free standing one not so great, the fridge made noise all night, they did give me a small credit and were nice enough about it,but hey it was near the beach:))
Manager Response: Dear Guest,             I wanted to thank you for choosing our hotel to stay. I do apologize for the inconvenience that you encountered during your stay. We do hope however you visit us again for a better experience on your next visit. May you have a wonderful day.

Summary: This hotel is a very nice, cute hotel. It is nothing like a 'normal' Holiday Inn.  Its more boutique. It is perfect location for walking to the local shops, beach and restaurants. Right next to a Ralphs grocery store and a few other shops for quick needs.  Good for business and leisure stay. I work in Irvine, CA which is just 20 minutes up the road (highway) so easy to get around.    Free wi-fi is good. There isn't free breakfast like other restaurants, but there is a good 'Orange Inn' across the street with good coffee, omelets, baked goods.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for choosing with us at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. we appreciate your business and Im glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary Heading: Good location, comfortable beds, an older hotel
Summary: This was my second stay in this hotel and I was here for four nights with my husband.  I had a downstairs room at the back of the hotel which was better than the top rooms.   Beds are comfortable and our room was very clean. The hotel is certainly aging and the bathrooms could do with a revamp or at least a paint. However, they are clean and functional. Tv was large and new, enough room for luggage and room to spare.   Unfortunately I stayed here during spring break so it was louder than my last visit. We were also outside the pool gate which continually slammed.  I would ask to stay away from the pool if you don't have small children and its busy.   Parking was $12 a day which I thought was a lot. It was half empty most of the time.  Close to good cafes and a great supermarket
Manager Response: Dear Guest,          Thank you for staying at our hotel. We appreciate you coming back to visit us and your feedback. We are always looking to improve so thank you for your suggestions. Hopefully you visit us again soon. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: The hotel is good and not pricy. They gave me a hard time before arrival and upgraded me and my wife to a suite. Great job, worth 5 stars... BUT the notice from the hotel that harassing and dangerous chemicals have been used to build the hotel and a health warning wants to give me the lowest rating. So I end up at average....
Manager Response: Dear Guest, I'm glad you enjoyed your stay. As for the warning sign at the entrance, unfortunately that is California law that we must warn all customers that we do use cleaning chemicals at the property which is nothing to worry about. Most of our products are the same as home use . Once again, thank you for staying with us.

Summary: This is our third or fourth time to stay here, with our adult children and grandchildren. It's easy to get in and out of, right off Pacific Coast Highway, and across the highway (good crossing signals) from a small beach. A little further north and you are at a much larger beach. Lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff is very accomodating.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,            My staff and I appreciate you and your family choosing our hotel to stay while on vacation. We are happy to know that you enjoy your stay with us. Thank you for your business and we hope you visit us again soon. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: We stay at this hotel every year. It's location is perfect. Across from a fabulous beach, great restaurants (Esp Orange Inn) and a grocery store, this hotel is ideal for anyone. We have 2 boys. The hotel beds are a bit small but overall, it's fantastic. The staff is great, and they offer lots of free snacks in the lobby. Heated pool, too! I would highly recommend! Can't wait to return.
Manager Response: Hello Mrspickens. I wanted to thank you and your family for staying with us here at Holiday Inn Laguna beach. We are happy to know that you and your family have a great time and we look forward to seeing you all again. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel. We stayed here on our trip from LA to San Diego. I was a bit worried seeing other reviews but this was a great place to stay. The manager on duty was very accommodating and friendly. The staff went out of their way to help us. There is a restaurant on site that had excellent customer service. Would definitely stay here again. The rooms downstairs are a bit bigger than the upstairs rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,         Thank you for staying with us at our hotel. My staff and I are happy to hear that you had a wonderful time and we appreciate your kind words. We hope that you will visit us again. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: Nicely remodeled room, great location ..we walked everywhere! The atmosphere is very relaxing with a New Orleans flair. We'd definitely stay again! Extra charge for parking though we thought it was included. $12.00 per night :-( .... but parking is charged everywhere in Laguna so the price was pretty reasonable. Very nice staff.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,           My staff and I appreciate your kind words. We are happy to hear that you had an enjoyable time at our hotel. We hope that you visit us again soon. May you have a wonderful day.

Summary: This hotel is an older property in the heart of Laguna Beach and across the street from a great cafe and access to the beach. The rooms were small but nicely decorated. If you're in Laguna Beach you shouldn't be in your room. This was a great value for a weekend get away. We would certainly stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Shawn M is correct that it is an older place, but that doesn't mean you would want to miss out on staying here. I was just there in Feb 2013 and I truly enjoyed this place! A very calm and relaxing atmosphere. The private courtyard was tropical and included a pool.  My room was quant, but the tv was a 37" HD. The beds were comfortable and had very nice linens, and the bathroom towels were good too. My room included a fridge too.   Excellent location and everything is within walking distance. Check out "The Deck" and "The Rooftop Lounge" if you like amazing views in relaxing environments.  Minor complaints: 1) coffee service wasn't available until 5am. I'm from the east coast so that meant 8am to my brain. 2) No microwave.
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to thank you for staying with us at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. It always makes my staff and I excited to hear that another one of our guest enjoyed their stay with us. Please visit us again soon. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: The Holiday Inn in Laguna Beach, while an older property, is so centrally located that you can overlook the dated appearance. For the price, a best value. The staff are very helpful and gave us great suggestions for dining and shopping, looking things up on the internet for us and giving accurate directions. The parking lot has ample sized parking spaces and is quite remarkable for such a value hotel. We look forward to returning again.
Manager Response: My staff and I are pleased to hear that you had a wonderful stay. We try to make everyone of our guests feel like they are at home. We would like to thank you for staying with us and look forward to having you stay with us again. Best of wishes from Holiday Inn Laguna beach.

Summary Heading: Odd property in a good location
Summary: I recently spent the night here and I have very mixed feelings. It's certainly a unique property and it's in a fantastic location in Laguna Beach. Upon check-in, they were very gracious and upgraded me to an enormous suite as a platinum member. However, I can't really say a lot of nice things about the room. It was large, yes, but it was very old and tired. It had french doors throughout which meant I couldn't leave any windows open as they were all on the walkway, including in the bathroom. This feels like a very old property that's been "spruced" up a bit but it could really use a lot more work before it feels modern, clean and contemporary.
Manager Response: Dear LBOskiBear,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate that you find our location to be convenient.  However,  We‚Äôre sorry about the room being dated. We will look into this point.  I assure you the feedback of our hotel will be reviewed and most certainly forwarded to the appropriate departments. We take  the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Until my stay here I would not have expected a 5 star experience at a Holiday Inn.  Everything was perfect and the staff are exceptionally accommodating.  The location is the best assest.  There is great public beach access directly across the street and all the shops and are right out the door.  We didn't eat at the restaurant but it is the same Chef as Alessa down the street where I have been and is superb.  Free wifi, coffe, lemonade, soda, bottled water, and popcorn 24hrs a day.  The front desk worker Elenora (i think ?) was absolutely terrific.
Manager Response: Hello hope you are doing well. Thank you for taking your time to give us some feedback. As always we try our best to make our guests feel at home away from home here at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. My staff will be very pleased to hear the kind feedback you have mentioned. We hope you can join us again if and when you are in town.

Summary: My family recently stayed at this hotel during a small portion of our trip to southern California. We had friends in Laguna Hills and wanted to stay closer to them and the beach. The reviews I had read before making reservations were pretty accurate.  The hotel is located across Coast Higway a block from the beach. There is a GREAT breakfast/lunch diner (the Oragange Inn) across the street from the hotel - highly recommended. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we did not try it. Also, there is a grocery store next door. Most importantly, there is a surf shop (for my son) across the street (Coasta Azul) across the street that rented wet suits and surfboards.  We were withing walking distance to the main street of town and there are many restaurants to chose from (varied
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved the room, the staff, the pool was clean, the proper TV with guide, the grounds and a Ralphs over the road. The smells coming from the kitchen were awesome. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was the $12 a night parking charge.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I can't wait to stay in Southern California again!
Summary: I loved the staff! The property was beautiful and so close to the beach! As soon as I walked into the lobby I was greated with smiles. Patty I believe was working front desk, she helped me with my first stay in Southern California. I was surprised that the staff didn't hesitate to help me with anything, including housekeeping! My room was cozy and looked very well kept. It's great that so many shops and restaurants are in walking distance too!
Manager Response: Good day to you. On behalf of myself and the staff at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach we would like to thank you for choosing our hotel during your stay. It is always good to hear good feedback from our guests. We appreciate your business and hope that you will join us again. Thank you!

Summary: i travelled to Laguna beach on accident because my car broke down on a sunday night around 12am, it was actually kind of scary because its so quiet there, anyway when i saw a sign of laguna beach holiday inn, i was a bit calm, becasue the lights were lit properly, and when i entered the hotel and explain my situation to a friendly clerk, they actually helped me push my car from the street and i parked it in the front of the lobby for the night, and i was given a special rate not only that and they comped my parking free for the night, also housekeeping took my luggage to my room, and i was very comfortable with the whole experience that i had with this small and charming hotel, i highly recommend this hotel to any traveler who travel through this area, this has changed my views
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed here for a night because of a huge family event that was taking place in Laguna beach. It's location is great. Close to the beach, ralphs market across the street, and a great bar downstairs. However, the rooms were a bit below average. I'm glad we only had to stay here for 1 night. I don't think I could have done 2 nights.   The entire hotel felt like a motel 6 with some cosmetic upgrades. They did a great job in the lobby, but the rest of the hotel grounds were below average. The best part was that they offered free coffee, tea, popcorn, and water up front in the lobby. nice touch.   They also offered free wifi which was so slow, but what the heck, it's free. They did charge us for parking. $12/day. A bit expensive for parking I thought.   I would have given
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for choosing our hotel for your event and I'm sorry to hear that you were not fully satisfied when you visited. If I may explain, we do offer late check out at no charge upon availability and we do offer a half a day charge for guests who wish to extend their stay until 4 PM since our check out time is at 11:00 AM. Unfortunately, the reason we could not accommodate your late check out request was one, late check out is 30 minutes to an hour after check out time but your whole group of 13 rooms wanted to check out by 3 to 4 pm and we had another group coming in for new years eve which is a sold out weekend for us so we had to get the rooms ready for them. I hope you'll give us another chance in the future if you do come back to town.

Summary: BEWARE OF MICHAEL.  He is extremely rude and will make you regret you ever stayed at this Holiday Inn!!!!  I stayed for two nights with my husband to visit his family for the holidays and we are part of their Priority Club.  The place is clean and in a good location.  Everyone I encountered during my stay was very kind and courteous...  EXCEPT for Michael.  I called after our stay because I had some questions about the bill.  Instead of being helpful and speaking to me in a nice way, he was extremely rude and VERY CONDESCENDING.  Instead of helping me to understand my bill, he tried his hardest to make me feel bad.  His tone and his attitude were uncalled for and I am very insulted that someone would be so intentionally mean.  IT IS ONLY BECAUSE OF MY CONVERSATION WITH HIM THAT
Manager Response: I would like to personally apologize for any misunderstanding about your bill and the way it was explained but would like to assure you again that the rates that we had for you were correct and was the same as what showed in your confirmation letter. I hope you come back and stay with us again if you come back to town.

Summary Heading: A good place to stay for a night
Summary: We read the reviews and didn't know what to expect.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  Our room overlooked the pool and was very quiet.  We liked the quaint look of the place and they were very generous with free water, coffee and popcorn in the lobby.  Our room was a little small but when you are in California near the beach, why would you want to stay in a hotel room?  Close to most everything which made walking everywhere possible.  Would stay again if in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. On behalf of the staff, we appreciate your feedback and kind words. If you are ever back in town we look forward to having you as our guest again. Take care and best wishes!

Summary Heading: Great location close to the beach and across from Ralph's grocery store.
Summary: Great location close to the beach and across from Ralph's grocery store. It is an old hotel and has some cool features, but it has seen better days. They try to keep it nice and it is decent, just not new. We had a suite and it had a fireplace and was a nice size but it showed its age.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An older but nice Holiday Inn in downtown Laguna Beach
Summary: This Holiday Inn is an older property, but it is well-kept. The rooms surround an inner courtyard with a pool and attractive garden. The rooms are a bit dated but are clean and comfortable. I've stayed at this hotel a few times recently, mid-week and off-season, and it's been very quiet. The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly. They even offered to print off a map on Map Quest for me, instead of merely providing verbal directions.   The really cool ammenities that this hotel offers are complimentary bottles of water, cans of soda, and fresh-popped popcorn in the lobby. What a nice touch! The Italian restaurant attached to this Holiday Inn, Mare Culinary Lounge, serves amazing food. It's not your 'typical' hotel restaurant and it is definitely worth a visit even if
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was very nice and very helpful.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The gardens were well done and well maintained. But, the place does need a face lift.  It is showing it's age and it is time to start renovation.  Would I stay here again, sure but it would not be my first choice.   By the way the location is primo for Laguna and I'll bet if you check prices for other accomadations in the immediate area you would give the HI a go.  Walk to most everything you could want to.  Just put a little paint on the walls and spit shine the chrome and the old lady could be brought back to its glory.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights during a trip up the coast to LA. This hotel is in a great location in that it is walking distance to 'downtown' Laguna and the beach.  It is also across the street from a Ralph's grocery store which is handy since there is a mini fridge in the room.  The room was clean and well maintained and overall the property was well cared for. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Overall this is a good spot to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rowdy party crowd in lounge ruin our stay
Summary: besides the location, this hotel has very little to offer in term of facilities and services.  during our family recent stay, one of our sons was sick and preventd us from exploring the area, so we decided to stay put and use what the hotel can offered.  well, it turned out that the hotel restaurant downstair was closed to all staying customers to host a private party with rowdy drinking crowd. the management even allowed the restaurant operator set up tables in courtyard area intefering the privacy of staying guests if you are looking for relaxing time in Laguna Beach, you will not find it at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here as part of our California Beach Vacation and expected a regular nice resort style Holiday Inn. However this hotel is located on a very busy 4 lane street with very small cramped rooms. No view, no balcony and very small windows directly looking into other rooms. The building is very narrow and small with the rooms on top of each other. You hear everything going on around you. Also we stayed 3 nights (checked in late and checked out early) and were charged 4 days for parking, which kind of felt as a rip off, even more as the parking grounds were under construction and very hard to access without proper signage or warning from the staff. We expected more........
Manager Response: none

Summary: Small rooms. De ent location. Friendly service.  Totally inadequate amenities starting with wifi that would make one pine for dial up; this is simply unacceptable I'm this day and age,  Parking situation is a mess ... Not trying to be unkind, but why would I want to stay here again?
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I'm sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectation but I'm glad that you've  enjoyed our friendly staff and location. I hope that you give us another chance if you come back our town.

Summary: We've stayed at a few places in Laguna Beach, and I have to say this Holiday Inn really exceeded my expectations.  Great location, right in the heart of the village.  Right across the street from the ocean, and within close walking distance to all the great shops and restaurants.  We stayed in a room on the second floor overlooking the pool.  Unfortunately the pool was closed for maintenance the week of our stay, but the manager called us a week prior to our visit to let us know.  Once we got there, they said we could use the pools across the street at Pacific Edge Hotel so it all worked out just fine.  The rooms were very clean, and the hotel itself is very pretty.  Beautiful wrought iron balconies and lush tropical plants all around.  Very nice.  Also liked having the Ralph's
Manager Response: Thank you from all of us here at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach  for your kind comments. we appreciate your business and hope to see you back soon.

Summary: I stayed at this Holiday Inn about a month ago and was so thrilled as my expectations of the place were very much exceeded. It is beautiful, elegant but also very "homey". The best part was the staff and how friendly and relaxed they were.  After leaving and heading back to Canada, I realized I left my keys in my room. The hotel was so kind and understanding; they mailed them back to me.   Very happy with the stay. Would recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing to stay at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. We appreciate your kind comments and hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Pretty standard Holiday Inn in a fantastic location. Lovely pool area, friendly front desk staff, clean rooms. Note that there is a steep parking charge ($12/day), and the rooms do not have safes. Easy drive from John Wayne airport. There's a grocery store next door and easy beach access right across the street.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a room for one night and ended up staying for 2.  Christian at the front desk was very helpful and knowledgable about restaurants, parking, etc...  The Hotel was very nice and clean, rooms were great and location is perfect!  We plan on making this our new vacation spot!
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and  thank you for choosing to stay at the Holiday inn laguna beach

Summary: I stayed at the Holiday Inn for 5 nights in late September. My room was on the second floor near the parking lot. Checkin was effortless.  The location of this hotel is great, right across the street from beach access and right next to Ralph's.  Every morning before I went into the office, I would take my coffee and walk a block or two on the beach.  The parking lot is conveniently located right behind the hotel.  There is a restaurant/bar on the 1st floor, nice location to have a nightcap.  The only thing I was not thrilled with were that the windows from the room overlook the hallway/courtyard and did not open (as far as I know).  If I go back to Laguna Beach, I would definitely consider this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Holiday Inn the last weekend in Sept.  We had a horrible room at another hotel and Michael at the front desk was wonderful and organized a couple of rooms for us.  He was so helpful and kind.  The rooms were nice (maybe a bit small), but the courtyard with all of the beautiful plants and flowers made up for it.  The pool is salt water which was fantastic.  The hotel is located within walking distance of everything and it is quiet in the rooms.  There is a awesome breakfast spot across the street with great coffee, homemade pastries, and yummy eggs.  Ralph's market is next door and Taco Bell for a quick burrito is across the street.  The beach is just a quick 5 min. walk away.  We absolutely loved this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Used Priceline and received a great deal. Had some concerns but that went away quickly. Older hotel with great charm and the location was perfect. Concert at Verizon to see DMB and quick trip home on the toll road. Good food down thr street at the Beach House and good view
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Laguna Beach holiday at the Holiday Inn
Summary: I was travelling with 2 teenaged girls and we had great and caring service from the friendly and helpful front desk staff and the cleaning personnel.  The room was perfect with a separate toilet and shower/ sink area which was key for getting ready to do anything with teenaged girls.  Our room opened onto the beautiful flowered courtyard where there were gazebos, a pool, and many cafe tables and chairs for quiet evening visits.  The location couldn't have been better.  We were across the road from the beach where you could walk all the way along to the main beach while enjoying the ocean.  The Holiday Inn is also across the road from a large store selling groceries and anything else you may have forgotten to pack.  It is situated on the main strip for all of the great
Manager Response: Dear cathy M,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach. We appreciate your kind comments and hope to see you soon.

Summary: After a poor check-in experience - turning up before 3pm does seem to really offend them - we had a great 5 night stay. Rooms are pretty spacious and comfortable. Pool area is quiet and attractive, good pool. Easy access to beach and restaurants, no problem with parking, and the free drinks and popcorn were a great touch.  We had a room at the back but the ones near the restaurant may be noisy.  Good hotel for a beach vacation, just don't arrive early
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: a little paradise in a relaxed an arty town
Summary: The hotel is lovely. There was a mess-up with our room from the company we booked with but the manager was fantastic- he upgraded us to a suite which was lovely, and didn't charge us anything like the full price, so we were happy. The suite was lovely & the bathroom mazing with a jacuzzi bath, and a we could just see the sea from the veranda outside the room.  The reception staff were very friendly, helpful & efficient. There was free popcorn, fresh lemonade, cans of coke, bottle of water, tea & coffee to help yourself to in reception. All the rooms in the hotel are facing over the swimming pool which is saltwater but warm & clean. The pool area is beautiful. The rooms were clean but a little dated- almost antique style furniture. Its not a modern Holiday Inn. The car parking is
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly staff, clean rooms, steps from the beach. The courtyard was beautiful and spacious. The swimming pool was unbelievable! We had an absolutely wonderful experience! Will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Worked for our purposes. Beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. Pool seemed icy. But then, there was no sun for 4 of the 5 days we were there. A trash can near the upper suites was full for 2 days and then brought down to the parking lot where it got even fuller and was still there 5 days later when we left. Free trolley stop for all over town almost in front of hotel. Ralph's across the street and the best breakfast cafe I have been to in ages with very very inexpensive prices (The Orange Inn).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another wonderful summer holiday in this garden hotel
Summary: We decided to return to Holiday Inn Laguna Beach since I just love the ambience of the enclosed garden and pool. As before, they staff were very friendly and catered to each of our requests in a timely manner. They had a new italian restaurant which doubled our pleasure of having some wine while looking at their wonderful garden... Highly recommended
Manager Response: none

Summary: Truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the staff was so friendly, the manangment was very pleasant.  The reception staff was very helpful and accommodating. Perfect location, the beach is just steps away.  Very quaint and beautifully landscaped hotel with a lovely lobby.  The rooms were very clean, spacious, large flat screen TVs and we had great service, they even provided free coffee, drinks, snacks and wi-fi.  The pool in the center of the property was perfect to relax in after a day at the beach.  We highly recommend this hotel, it is close to the beach, to downtown Laguna, lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance, a great value for the spend.  We had a great time and plan on returning for our next visit to Laguna Beach.  Thank you Laguna Holiday Inn!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Relaxing place with a great location
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during the busy season. The location is great! A short walk to the beach. They have a nice restaurant in the hotel. It is nice to sit outside, the scenery is pretty with trees and flowers. They also have Ralphs supermarket, Orange Inn and Taco Bell across the street. Down the street are shops and other restaurants. There is a trolley that has many stops in the Laguna area including The Pageant of the Masters. You can catch that very close to the hotel.  The staff was very pleasant. They were helpful when we needed directions to places and suggesting great places to eat. In the lobby they had free popcorn, sodas and water. They also had a computer to use.  The room was comfortable and clean. Self parked and do have to take luggage down up and down stairs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not bad value for the area - fairly good stay and lovely, friendly staff!
Summary: The hotel was a no-frills, simple stay as expected - however our room was very dark and the AC loud (although this blocked out a lot of sound from the neighbours). There wasn't really much room for the 3 of us and I hated the motel-like feel of everyone being able to look in through the windows (although of course, there were curtains, but if they were opened you had no privacy). The only windows were looking out onto the outside corridor, where everyone walked past! The staff at the desk were very helpeful and friendly, and there were nice touches in the lobby including free drinks (mineral water, coke, coffee, tea etc), popcorn and a free use of a computer + internet. There was also free wi-fi in the hotel with a good connection. I used the pool once in our stay and it was
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment. we appreciate all the feed back that we get since it helps us better our services. Once again, Thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: Should not be part of the Holiday Inn Chain - Very Low Key Motel Environment
Summary: Avoid this hotel if you can. You are better off paying more money to stay at a nicer hotel or save money and stay at Best Western of Travelodge-They seem nicer than this place.  The hotel is a very run down hotel that has nice pictures on the website and has nice landscaping.  The rest of the hotel, such as rooms, common areas, parking, hallways, etc are HORRIBLE! They remember a motel environment and reminded me of the Holiday Inn Motels in the 80's.  The rooms are in major need of a renovation and are dirty, mildewed, small, and the a/c units are very small window units that do not cool the rooms.  We had a torn mattress, broken iron and ironing board, broken door lock, broken electrical outlet that caused the lights to go out in the room taking 30 minutes to fix, sand on the
Manager Response: Dear VPN,  I appreciate your comments and your view of our property however, we don't appreciate threats of a bad review if we don't discount. I would like to assure all viewers that if there is a problem with a guest room, we are more than happy to change the room, fix the problem or discount that portion of the stay. As everyone can see from our other reviews, the number one priority in our hotel is customer service and our friendly and professional staff. I'm surprised to see that you also have left a negative review for Laguna Beach itself which was voted one of the most beautiful beaches in Orange County and just a correction to your review, we are just across the street from the beach. Once again, thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: I stayed here 2 years ago and gave the hotel a 5 star rating.  However this stay was a complete 180 degree turn for the worse.  The price of the hotel doubled, the quality of the room was not how I remembered, dirty towels in the bathroom and an unreasonably loud rumbling air conditioner.  I would not stay here again and not recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear NYGD,  I‚Äôm sorry to hear that you were not satisfy with your stay and hope that you‚Äôll give us another chance if you come back to laguna beach. The rates are usually higher during the summer season but you can find lower rates during the off season. Thank you.

Summary: First off I did not get the same Priority Club Gold Member treatment as I just had experienced in San Diego, but maybe they just overlooked this fact even though we paid our stay with points. The gentlemen who checked us in could have been a bit friendlier but maybe he just had a rough day. The rest of the staff including the maids were very friendly. The hotel looks very nice from the outside and from the inside, and is clean. The lobby offers complimentary water bottles and coffee. The rooms have a fridge and are well sized, with what seems to be a fairly new, spacious shower. The vanity sink is outside the bathroom which is practicalk. All the rooms, however, seem to face the courtyard/ pool which gives it a little bit of a motel feeling. If you only need a clean place to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at one of the suites for 2 nights.  We had no choice as August is a very busy month in Laguna.  The front desk staff were very polite.  The suite however is horrible.  The mattress was so worn out (or cheap) it sank in the middle.  The AC was loud but the noise helped mask some of the noise from the neighbors.  The walls are paper thin!    The view of our $300+ suite was the grungy roof of the building.  Of course no breakfast or parking for this price!  We will not return...
Manager Response: I‚Äôm sorry to hear that you were not completely satisfy with your stay and hope that you‚Äôll give us another chance if you come back to Laguna beach.

Summary: We stayed at this property in late summer 2011 (sorry for the late review).  The property is a square courtyard, so all the room entrances, balconies face out to an interior pool area. There is a grocery store across the side street for that late night beer run!   The pool itself is great clean and very deep at one end and also well maintained.  This hotel is right on the main street in LG Beach, and you can take a free trolley to the restaurants at night.  There is a great Tex/Mex place about 5 blocks south (cannot remember the name) and it is a short drive to Dana Point and the state park to the south (highly recommended).  Here's a plus, there was a glitch on my hotel charges and when I called about a month later, the person was super friendly, found the details of my stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was in Laguna Beach on Friday, July 20 to attend the Festival of the Arts.  Even though I arrived in mid-morning well before check-in time, the hotel staff allowed me to park in the lot all day until I was ready to check in.  The hotel is centrally located on South Coast Highway, within easy walking distance to most restaurants and art galleries along the strip.  Even though this was a "free" Priority Club points stay, the staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable, and the wireless internet access worked great.  The Ralph's grocery store across the street makes it very convenient to get snacks for breakfast, or any time of day.  I have stayed at this Holiday Inn several times before, and will definitely come back again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel with one of a kind restaurant in it...
Summary: I returned here after a few years..I found the place as nice and enjoyable as ever before, only that they now have this great Italian restaurant on the property, we enjoyed one of our best ever Italian dinning experience!! Recommend it full heatedly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my second stay at this hotel and I simply love it. The staff was very welcoming and I was actually remembered by the G.M which was quite suprising!!  My room was perfectly clean and was inviting. It was actually hard for me to leave the room at one point because the beds were so comfortable.  A huge plus for this hotel is the location, it is to die for!! Its walking distance to the main beach and all of the stores/resteraunts. There is also a Ralphs supermarket next door which is very convienient.  All in all this hotel is the best around and is the best priced in the area. I highly recommed it for people who are very picky about cleanliness.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were basic, clean, quiet and priced appropriately for the location. The staff was very professional.  The location was incredible.  Walk across coast highway, down a tiny, short street to the public steps that take you to the beach.  Walk across the street in another direction to the grocery store. It's a 10 minute walk to main beach or you could take the free shuttle which is just outside the hotel.  We walked to a great restaurant and also the mile to the Pageant of the Masters.  Coast Highway traffic is busy; it was nice to be able to walk everywhere.  Two people with us preferred not to walk on the return from the Pageant.  We walked, they took the shuttle and we arrived back at the hotel at the same time!  Another perk is the restaurant and bar they have on site.
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the nicest Holiday Inns I have ever stayed at. Great location very clean property. Complimentary bottled water, soda, coffee tea and popcorn. Breakfast was not included there was a restraunt on the premises we did not eat there. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Definetly would recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: great location, friendly staff, decent hotel courtyard area
Summary: Visited property with family while visiting from Belgium.  Great experience, very central, across from beach access, grocery store across street, very professional staff, nice lobby. Only issue was that our room (room 52, I think) had some water stains on ceiling and somewhat worn-out wallpaper (this should be addressed).  Highly recommended, though I wish it were a bit cheaper. :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment and feedback. I did send the maintenance and took care of the paint.

Summary: Beautiful little lobby with fireplace running all hours (it gets pretty cool, especially evening.) Very pleasant staff, especially the general manager (woman) and "Christian" who seemed to be on duty from the time we arrived to the time we left. All staff responsive and helpful. Gorgeous rectangular courtyard/pool area with splendid greenery, Bougainvillea, geraniums and other flowering species. Lovely outdoor gathering spots including beautiful gazebo. Perfect location for exploring the town and the beach. So much better than your average HI. Didn't get a chance to try the restaurant but the smell beckoned each night, and when I go back again I will definitely partake!
Manager Response: I wanted to personally thank you for your comments. I‚Äôm glad to hear that you‚Äôve enjoyed your stay and hope to see you back next time.

Summary Heading: Wanted to keep this one to myself....
Summary: We've stayed at bigger, fancier places - but none better. This is the jewel in the Holiday Inn crown. Of course, it's a jewel in the beautiful setting of Laguna Beach, and it's location is perfect. A 5 minute walk to The Cliff for oceanside cocktails and good food, and a10 minute stroll to the town centre. The establishment is beautifully put together - just two floors, poolside and a balcony above. No endless corridors and waiting for elevators. The pool is heated for year round use, and surrounded by comfortable sun loungers and shaded tables and chairs. There is a beautiful gazebo covered with climbing roses and bougainvillea, and luxuriant plantings everywhere. The recently opened 'Mare' restaurant shares the premises, and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner, or drinks in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were there in late April 2012 for a wedding in Newport. We did not expect much but this turned out to be a lovely property.  Our room was large with a Bay Window.  All the rooms are around the pool, with lovely lush vegetation, tables, chairs, umbrellas, chaise lounge.  Though no breakfast is offered (unlike most Holiday Inns), there was free coffee, tea, soda, bottled water and popcorn 24/7 in the lobby.  The reception was very friendly. The room was spotlessly clean.  The bed comfortable with lots of fluffy pillows, soft and firm. Our choice. There was a huge tiled step in shower wih a seat.  Great water pressure  Good closet space with proper wooden hangers (not those metal things that won't come off the rail).  Nice dark wood desk with WiFi.Large flat screen TV.  Cabinet
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found this Holiday Inn by chance What a wonderful place. It feels like a Spanish hacienda with the rooms arranged in courtyard style around the pool. There were pretty flowers all around the pool that was heated even though it was February We loved the location of this special place,walking distance to the village and just across the street from the beach ,all at a great rate . No breakfast was served but there was a great healthy food breakfast cafe directly across the street. A great place if you like smaller boutique type hotels
Manager Response: I‚Äôm glad that you‚Äôve enjoyed your stay and appreciate your compliment. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Lovely pool area - good location - comfortable room
Summary: Our daughter is living in Orange for a few months so this is our second stay in Laguna within the last 6 weeks. We love Laguna!!! The first time we stayed at the Inn at Laguna Beach - loved the location right near Main Beach. But for this last trip rates much higher there and when we walked by the hotel, saw that their pool area was under full reconstruction. We were very happy with the Holiday Inn for this trip. It is further south but we could still walk to our favorite dinner spot, Nick's and Ralphs grocery store is right across the street. The front desk staff was very very helpful and nice. We were in room #17 - it was spacious - especially the bathroom counter area was great. We especially liked the pool area. It was very lush and pretty. They did offer free wi-fi. Parking
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you set your expectations that you are in Laguna Beach, across from the ocean, and that you won't be in your room often, then this is a perfect hotel for you. Our team was on business and opted for the Holiday Inn Express in Laguna Beach because of its location and price. We looked at other (off brand) hotels in the area and the reviews looks bad on tripadvisor.com. We were really happy that the beds were comfortable and everything was walking distance away. Check in was fast and the hotel was in good shape. This is not a $300-$400 level place, so set your expectations right. It's a fun hotel that is perfect for business, solo, or group of friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just wanted to say we had a lovely stay here.  The front desk was so helpful and really friendly. Great staff.  My kids loved the complimentary lemonade.  I loved easy access to bottled water and coffee.  The hotel is not large, but the lobby area is a really nice meeting place.  I was happy every time I walked in the door.  The flowers really make the hotel and it is nice to see that a small space can be so inviting.  I will say the rooms are smallish but the excellent location outweighs this as a concern for me.  We ran to the grocery store quite a few times so that was very handy.  We could walk to great restaurants and the beach was just across the street.  Good value all around.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in suite, room 49.  It was very roomy and comfortable.  The bathroom is quite big, almost as big as the bedroom, with a step-up whirlpool tub/shower, but only one sink.  The hotel is centered around a pool courtyard and the rooms can only be accessed through locked gates or staffed lobby. (the pool must be original to the hotel, as it is eight feetdeep, but in good shape with nice tiles.)  The one very unfortunate aspect of our stay, was the knocking sound all night because even a slight breeze caused the gate right under our room, to rattle every few minutes.  Otherwise the hotel is very solid and quiet.  Some of the rooms have balconets on the outside of the building.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice hotel.  A Holiday Inn with a bit of a boutique hotel feel.  Nice rooms, comfortable bed.  Only thing is the carpet is alittle dated.    Very good location, within walking distance to the beach, all the good restaurants and shopping destinations.  There is also a supermarket across the street.  They also offer drinks and popcorn at the lobby for all the guests.  The front desk was very accomodating and friendly. They even checked me in 6 hours before the standard check in time as we were extremely tired after an international flight which arrived at 6am.  They also allowed us to check out late.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: I normally tend to stray away from holiday inn and would prefer more boutique style places, but I was really happy with my stay here. The grounds were really nice and the Location is great. The staff was really friendly and helpful and next door is a super market for late night snacks. More importantly the beds were comfortable. I would come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. we appreciate your business and hope to see you soon.

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach for ten days from March 19 to 29, 2012. I am Priority Club Platinum member and I decided to use my reward points for a California vacation, using this hotel as our home base. As others have said, you can't fault this hotel in terms of basic amenities, cleanliness and location. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of all that Laguna Beach has to offer.  My only beef with the hotel is that they refused to upgrade us to a suite even though I am a Platinum member. We were given a standard courtyard room on the second level, which was small and not suited to an extended stay. When I asked at the front desk about an upgrade, I was told that there were no
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment. I just would like to clarify the priority club members benefit on room upgrades. As a member of priority club which is Holiday inns reward program, a platinum member gets a room upgrade if its available and that does not include any suites just the next level room up. Since we are a small property with only 4 suites, they sell out fast and if they are available, we don‚Äôt mind upgrading members but probably since the length of the stay was 10 days, we were sold out on some days so we could not upgrade.We do appreciate your business and we thank you for staying with us.

Summary: This hotel is in a good location, easy to walk to the beach, restaurants and shops. But, it's not your typical Holiday Inn: it's more like a New Orleans style hotel, with a central courtyard and rooms that surround the courtyard. It's old, but it has character and the pool area is very nice, nicely landscaped and good chairs and lounges. Internet is free, but there's a charge to park. They offer free popcorn, water, soft drinks and coffee in the am, but no breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Love this hotel - have made a return trip!
Summary: This hotel is perfectly situated.  Not quite the center of town, but still walking distance to lots of cool shops, restaurants and coffee shops.  Although it faces the main road, it is very quiet.  As others have noted, the decor is a bit dated, but it has tons of character.  The main lobby has lemonade, coffee, tea and popcorn going all the time.  The hotel is laid out around a charming courtyard with a swimming pool and tropical gardens.  There is a Ralph's supermarket right next door which opens early in the morning, and we loved being able to run over and grab some fresh fruit and a croissant for breakfast every morning, or a snack at the end of the day.  We have stayed here a couple of times when we were visiting the Orange County area.  There are some beautiful, much more
Manager Response: I‚Äôm glad to hear that you‚Äôve enjoyed your stay and hope to see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Nice Service, Really Tired, Old Rooms
Summary: We began with a great welcome.  All workers were very nice, kind and accomodating.  Great walking distance to all restaurants. The pool area is very pretty, and even though it was close to the main road, it was pretty quiet.  However, the room we were in (and we were told we had a very nice room), was so old, tired and there literally was a "hole in the wall" by the bed.  The phone and clock, where incredibly dirty (They did compensate for these things).  We called it surfacy clean, if you looked close, there was a lot of grim on things.  And, since all the doors are facing the outdoor area, it was pretty loud when people walked by or by the pool, however at night, the clientele was very quiet, and sleeping was good.   I hate to be negative because the staff was so kind, but
Manager Response: Gregsfinds,  Thank you for your review and being so detailed in the good, the bad and the very good! Whilst I am pleased with the good and the really good comments, I truly value the bad comments as this gives us the opportunity of improving what we already do. We will address these points and I hope that when you return you will see the improvements that have been made. Thank you again for your review.  Ben J IHG Care

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: After a work week in Anaheim, my wife and I stayed here for the weekend before heading back to the cold climates of the upper midwest. We were delighted. This hotel is a little experienced, but its age only adds to its character. The courtyard swimming pool and garden is a tranquil little place to relax away from the hustle of PCH. And when you're in the mood to partake in the hustle, it's right outside the door!   The Holiday Inn is a short walk to the downtown area and many great restaurants. On Friday night we noshed at Three Seventy Common and Saturday night we splurged at Sapphire -- the hotel is equidistant between both of them.  Also, you'll be at Laguna Beach because you want to hang out at the beach, right? No worries, just cross PCH and walk down a set of steps and you
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment. We appreciate your business and hope to see you back.

Summary: Even though this is an older property, it looks to be well maintained and the location is very convenient.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was comfortable and quiet.  It's situated on the main street of Laguna, but far enough away from the noise and traffic of downtown.  It's within walking distance of many restaurants and shops.  There's a restaurant on the property for breakfast, but it's rather cave-like, so we decided to walk downtown and enjoy the perfect weather.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment. Our restaurant has a new ownership and it will be Italian. We appreciate your business and hope to see you back.

Summary: This was a great little hotel. It is within walking distance of most of the shops and restaurants and access to public beach is just across the street. The rooms were great the pool is verry private and quite. All the employes were friendly and very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quiet and great value for money.
Summary: This hotel is great, the rooms are not new but they are well appointed and kept very clean. Located on the south side of Laguna Beach the hotel is close to most shops and there is a supermarket across the road. No real view from the hotel itself but there is a great atmosphere. We were upgraded to a suite on the third floor up the rear of the hotel. Not having a lift is one of the only drawbacks. The suits are huge with great bathrooms and a fireplace. Staff are friendly and have good knowledge of the local area. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Other hotels in this area tend to be expensive, filthy or both but not this one. Clean, comfortable and a great staff! Free movie theater popcorn and lemonade, coffee, soda and bottled water for guests. Less than 10 minutes to the main beach and the smaller Cleo Street beach is across the street!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Cute building but the room was extremely tired.  Clean.  In room phone did not work.  Nice pool area
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there with friends in November 2011, The hotel was very nice and conveniently located at the Laguna Beach, just across the street from the beach. The rooms are around a courtyard with a nice pool. There are complimentary drinks and some snacks (pop corn) at the reception area. The parking is behind the hotel and is free of charge.
