The rooms are ok. The staff was ok too. What they call "fitness center" is just a small room with a couple of machines :-)   Overall it's a nice hotel if you don't expect much.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Noisy aircon, noisy lounge bar, good location
Summary: Location is good, a short walk from both downtown Laguna Beach and Aliso Creek. Staff were friendly and efficient in the most part. The most upsetting part of our stay however was not being told their restaurant \ lounge is open until 2am and turns into a dance \ music bar with very loud music. Our room was right next to this so we could not sleep as a result - we were moved to another room the next day as the hotel was quiet.  The hotel walls are thin and so noise from adjacent rooms is very audible. There are aircon \ extractor fans fitted to all of the upper level rooms. This equipment is very old as it rattles, whines and generally makes a lot of noise for 18 hours per day.   The rooms themselves were adequate if a little tired. Cleanliness was OK. WIFI was free and decent
Manager Response: none

Summary: I don't spend a lot of time in my room when in Laguna Beach, so I overlook that the rooms could use a little refreshing.   The staff is always fantastic and the hotel has a very cool California vibe.   Most importantly, you are downtown and can easily walk to any of the bars or hotels in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spotlessly clean, extremely comfortable reasonably priced, fantastic location friendly helpful staff. Ralphs supermarket located next door for easy access to food, beer and wine if you want to eat poolside or pick up lunch to take to the beach. We travelled from San Fran to San Diego over two weeks and this was the only place we stayed more than one night. Our group of four travellers unanimously agreed that this was the best overall hotel of our trip, (considering location, comfort, amenities, people etc).
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for two nights at the Holiday Inn, and loved it. The setting round the pool is lovely - just a shame that the bar wasn't open until the evening when we were there. However there is a Ralphs supermarket just over the road. The location could not be better, just a short stroll downhill to the main beach and shops.  The staff were always extremly courteous and heplful - even suggesting that we try the Orange Cafe over the road for breakfast. Excellent advice - breakfast burritos to die for.  It would be nice to have tables and chairs out on the hotel walkways - but I guess health and safety may forbid that! Lovely, quiet hotel near to everything Laguna has to offer.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Eclectic Place 1 block from the beach
Summary: Courtyard around a pool setup with a Southwestern flare makes this place really fun to stay!  Clean and only 1 block away from the beach.  Just a little far for walking to the outstanding shopping in downtown Laguna Beach.  Orange Cafe restaurant across the street is great place for breakfast & lunch. Grocery store across the street makes it convenient to save money if traveling with a family and want to each around the courtyard pool.  They washed the deck every day and cleaned the pool, so it was spotless.  This is an older kind of hotel, but is kept in excellent shape and very clean.  It's got some real character.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I usually don't write reviews, but was compelled to come to this site to write about this wonderful property.  In a nutshell......outstanding location, outstanding value, quaint, cozy, amazingly comfortable beds.  Also loved having a Ralph's market directly across the street!  Friendly staff, 24-hr. free coffee, internet, popcorn and sodas in the lobby!  Our in-room hair dryer didn't work, and when I called the front desk to tell them, they were literally at our door in LESS than 5 minutes with a brand new hair dryer!  Stay at this hotel.  It can't be beat!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with my husband. Service was outstanding! We arrived after a 12 hour flight from Australia and were told at 9am we could check in! A really nice thing after an overnight flight. Free water and popcorn was great too. Beds were so comfortable, I love the pillow menu (firm or soft - you choose!) grocery store across the road. So close to the beach. would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value, location, service and value
Summary: A real surprise for a Holiday Inn. Cute, tidy, nice rooms, great value, free Internet.  Its been reviewed a lot so to save boring you, that's it! Just adding my satisfaction to the statistics.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very cute and Cosy hotel. Lovely atmosphere and amazing staff. The gardens are spectacular and light fittings in rooms and bed heads add to the romantic whimsical feel. Rooms all have people walking past so you can't really open your windows for some light but it wasn't a major issue. Beach across the street, market on the other side. Easy parking close to rooms. Refreshments in lobby. Room was pretty small to the point where the front door hits the bed, but it is forgivable and for a short 1 or 2 night stay it's fine. Quite clean. A few tiny fly looking creatures around inside the room. No bad smells or mould though. Curtains are also not the best. Lights from outside shine in at night and footsteps are plenty from above and outside, again though not major issues.  Would stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just stayed to this little gem for two nights. The rooms were normal , nice motel rooms but the location can not be beat. The hotel is right on PCH/the main street of Laguna , so it is an easy walk to the beach and the restaurants and bars. There is a super market right across the street, very convenient as there is a large frig in the room. But what is so special about this chain hotel is the jungle like courtyard/ atrium . The plants and blooms are just lovely, as is the entire pool area. Also there are free drinks and very tasty popcorn in the lobby. I would diffinately stay again. There were only negatives, the curtesy bath supplies were tinny tiny and there is no natural light because you can't open the curtains as everyone walking by can view in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach for two nights. The hotel was unexpectedly sweet and quaint, not the usual Holiday Inn chain hotels. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, although the room was a bit squeezed. Very nice shower area.   The hotel is located right on the main shopping street and cross the street from the beach. Very conenient for eating out, shopping and relaxing. There is no breakfast provided, but complementary snacks and drinks in the lobby. Staff were friendly. For a nice and light meal, I'd recommand the Orange Cafe across from the hotel.  Only one slight problem is that there is some lack of privacy since all the rooms open to the courtyard, so there could be cleaners and guests walking past the window and see into the room, so need to keep the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel on our way down the coast.  The hotel is ideally located near numerous restaurants.  The beach is a short block away.  The pool area was a nice place to relax and cool off (even though it was plenty cool enough) before going out for the evening.   There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance.  There is also a pretty cool surf shop just across the street, where you can rent surfing equipment.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone visitng Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: stayed for 2 nights at the end of september. staffs were nice, friendly and fast. had an issue with the tv, someone came within 5 minutes. the room was kind of tiny for 4 people but it all worked out. they have only 2 double beds only, wish they had 2 queens. we went surfing so we love this area. everything in a walking distance about 10 minutes to downtown laguna for all the restaurant they had offered. they have the hose outside to rinse urself before walking to the hotel. soda, water, coffee, popcorn available at the front desk for FREE. there was a computer at the front desk, free of charge. good parking $10 a night tho, for me it's acceptable. love it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel and Staff- can't wait to go back
Summary: Hotel is very artsy like Laguna Beach.  Beautiful flowers and pool area with immaculate large rooms - modern newly renovated bathrooms.  The staff was wonderful and very accomodating. They had fresh coffee, sodas,  lemondade and popcorn in the lobby  all day.  I would recommend this hotel to all - can't wait to go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had booked a room at the Pacific edge and when we got to our room it was horrible.  It was tiny and faced the highway.  We went for a walk and my wife suggested that I go in to the Holiday Inn to see if they had a room.  They were SOOO nice and they did have a room.  It was twice the size and less money.  It was also off the road and very quiet.  What a great place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Only stayed one night in May 2011. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was cute. The front desk gave us suggestions on where to eat and things to do. The room was kind of small but that may be standard for Laguna Beach. It's across the street from the beach, which is beautiful. No complaints what so ever about the hotel though. I would stay again if I returned to Laguna.  Honestly, Laguna Beach seemed kind of boring to me, but I'm not very artsy which may have been part of it. Next time I'll probably go back to Venice Beach where there was always something to see or do!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property has some very serious problems.  The management tries to pass them off as problems with the city.    The July comment of sewage smell in the rooms of this hotel is dead on right!  To the point where it is sickening.  Not to mention the bugs that were in the room.  I'd be VERY CAREFUL about your stay at this hotel!  It's not worth the chance!
Manager Response: This guest came to us after a three day stay and complained about a smell on the property. He told us that as a result of this he did not want to be charged for the entire three day stay. In addition, he said if this was not granted he would report us to Tripadvisor as well as the city. We did not feel it is fair to grant him this request because if the guest was unhappy he should have left after one day or notified us at that time. After he wrote this review on Tripadvisor and filed a complaint with the city, the city inspector reviewed our property and could not find any fault whatsoever with our hotel. A copy of this report is available should anyone wish to see it. Anyone staying in a coastal location knows that there is an occasional sea breeze which some people find nostalgic while others might find unpleasant. This has nothing to do with our hotel. We hope you will look at all the other reviews that our guests have written throughout the years.   Nooshin, General Manager

Summary Heading: Quaint little hotel, not typical Holiday Inn
Summary: Stayed here while on holiday in California after seeing it in Trip Advisor. it i snot your typical Holiday Inn, more like a small family run business. Roomes were nice and clean, nice little pool within a fenced in garden which was kept spotless. Hotels in laguna are busy and expensive but thi smost definatley looked th evalue hotel to stay in. Good location, close enough to beach, buses just outside. Only had breakfast which is typical American fare and of similar price to most hotels.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second stay at this Holiday Inn, and it was even nicer than I remembered. The rooms are average sized and updated, with nice flat screen TVs, coffee makers, refrigerator, hair dryer, granite vanity, super clean bathrooms, no nasty odors, nice decor. Did I mention clean?!  The beds & pillows are fresh & comfy, and I've never noticed noise from the highway or other patrons. They have a private parking lot, which is important in busy Laguna, but there is a $10 per night parking fee.  However, the hotel's location is terrific. Summary: When a lot of other hotels along Laguna Beach are deteriorating and pricing themselves out of business the Holiday Inn was a very welcome surprise! They accommodations were immaculate with large flat screen TV, fridge, hair dryer, ironing board & a very nice pool in a "New Orleans" setting. In the lobby they offer free bottles of water, popcorn, coffee, tea, lemonade and Internet use.  There is also a restaurant on premises and a cocktail lounge  with Happy Hour prices on drinks & food.  It is approx. one half mile walk into town and directly across the street from easy access to the beach down some stairs. We will be going back!

Each room had a large flat screen TV.  Easy walking distance ( 100 yds )  to the beach although you'll probably use the beach area a couple blocks south or north of the hotel.  Tons of dining nearby and a full grocery store ( Ralphs )  across the street.  Free coffee, bottled water, pepsi, lemonade, and popcorn in the lobby.  Plenty of dining choices within walking distance to suit most tastes.  We will definitely stay here again.

Easily within walking distance of bars and restaurants and you just have to cross the road to get onto the beach which was also lovely. We could only stay two nights as we had to get to Vegas to meet friends but we would have loved to have been able to chill out there for a little longer.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Kind of, almost wonderful place to stay....
Summary: I had only one night on my own before heading back to San Diego for a conference so I picked Laguna Beach to hang out. I didn't have a clue where to stay so I found the Holiday Inn with my Iphone. It was ok. Just that, ok. The rooms smell pretty musty but were clean. The location cannot be beat right across the street from the beach and a Ralph's grocery store. I have to admit of all things to being uneasy at the hotel. My room was on the end and despite being within a locked gate-it just felt scary like someone could blow through the flimsy window. Kind of funny actually, as I travel a lot on my own and here I am, in laguna beach, frightened.! Go figure. I think it was just the vibe of the motel and the overabundance of homeless on the streets. All in all. it was ok. They tried

Summary: Lovely Hacienda style building with a very well kept courtyard with a pool and very nicely landscape, access to the rooms is done from exterior corridors around the courtyard - I can imagine this is a great place to stay in the spring and summer.  The rooms are what you expect at a Holiday, no frills, but these are very clean and updated. The hotel has a great location near the "Village" across from a breach access and a 24hr grocery store.  The staff I encountered was extremely friendly even offered a suite upgrade (which I didn‚Äôt take since I was traveling alone in the dead of Winter).  All in all, a great stay at a great price!

Summary: This was our first trip to Laguna Beach and although we wished to base our selves as near to the beach as possible -  hotel prices are somewhat high at this beautiful resort but this proved to be a little haven offering a comfortable room, good service and a 5 mintue walk to the beach!  Ralphs is just across the way if you need any supplies and with an abudance of place to eat - all accesible on foot, - you had lots of choices to make for a great stay!  The only downside of not staying in a hotel based right on the beach is that it is impossible to hire a sun lounger for the day but hey it was still a great stay and staff were very helpful. Summary Heading: An amazing Hotel, a great stop over on our honeymoon!

The room we had was really lovely, really spacious, a massive bed, Flat screen tv and good size shower room. All the rooms look over the pool,  the pool area is beautiful, lots of flowers and comfy loungers. It's like a hidden retreat in the centre of the hotel. You can also grab free drinks from the reception area. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar in the evening, it's a modern dim lite bar, which looks out onto the main road that cuts through the centre on laguna. Summary Heading: Wish I stayed one more day!

Summary: My boyfriend brought me here with our dog to get away for the weekend. I was impressed at the cleanliness of the grounds, politeness of the staff and the location.  The ocean is just across the street and down the hill!!  There are wonderful little places to eat everywhere and a grocery store right across the street. Our room was clean, quiet had updated decor and access to the courtyard was available only to those who had hotel keys. It's not everyday that one can stay at a nice hotel that accepts pets, this Holiday Inn is one of those.

Summary: Having recently stayed here, I would recommend this hotel to those seeking to visit Laguna Beach on a budget. The hotel is clean with our room a recently remodeled. The pool area provides an oasis "type" feel and "street noise" is barely audible. The hotel is within walking distance to the beach, downtown Laguna, numerous restaurants, and there's a grocery store across the street to pick up items (we like having fresh fruit.) The hotel staff is friendly, though not overly helpful. However, the restaurant/bar located on premise is not owned by the hotel, and since we elected to eat elsewhere, can not provide an objective opinion. A few blocks south of the hotel is a local breakfast to lunch cafe with good food at reasonable prices. Overall, would stay in this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Just what I needed! Will stay here again.
Summary: I am a frequent business traveller to Orange County and have stayed at several different hotels in Laguna Beach. Really liked this hotel alot. The location cannot be beat...just off PCH and Cleo, next to the Ralph's grocery store (really convenient since the room had a fridge).  The layout of the hotel has room doors opening to the outside onto a large courtyard with alot of tropical plants and a pool.  There are many tables and chaises in the courtyard where you can hang out  and work, read or nap.  The vibe of the hotel is totally chill and relaxed. Summary: We paid $119/night plus $6 for parking.    The previous reviews I read on tripadvisor about this hotel was the deciding factor on us staying at this particular hotel.  I think that the reviews were overrated.  The hotel is on the corner of Pacific Coast Hwy 1 and Cleo.  Walk right across the street and you are at the beach.  There is a Ralph's grocery store across the street and Orange Inn, a small breakfast place with fresh juice and muffins and great coffee.  The location is very safe.  The hotel itself does have a Mediterranean look to it.  The room we had was average, it was clean, but not the luxurious place that other reviewers described...but they may have gotten newer rooms.  The shower was marble but not our sink.  There were nice soaps and shampoos available.

As a woman I try to avoid hotels with outdoor hallways, mainly for safety reasons. So I must admit that I went into this trip expecting to be disappointed in the hotel itself. Summary: This place was absolutely wonderful!! Clean rooms, excellent service, and a very tropical pool area. Each room faces poolside. Will return again!!!

Summary Heading: This time, Absolutely Great, No Exceptions
Summary: Last year during our stay at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach, the staff and the length of the beds slightly marred a perfect vacation.  This year, everything was absolutely spectacular!  Staff was sooo pleasant!  We will return again and again, and we will ask for room 52.  You simply have to try this hotel, I may regret this next time I try to book it, as it may not be available, but when you find a place this spectacular, you cannot keep it to yourself.

Summary: After reading reviews the Holiday Inn sounded like a good choice....& it was.  It is basically a beach town motel.  The room was reasonably clean but not fancy in any way.  Good location.  The price is high for what you get but that is Laguna....

Summary: I chose to stay here afer I read the reviews here. The hotel has had a very nice upgrade and the staff was very helpful. The big problem is the hotel should have done an upgrade to double paned windows to help with the noise. The hotel is built around a pool and restaurant/bar. The noise echos off the building and kept us up through the night. It was much better on Sunday night, but only because the weekend crowd had gone. I would stay here again only if it was midweek.

Summary: Overall the hotel is great, compared to all the other hotels during our Southern Cal. experience at the end of June!  This hotel had an updated, clean bathroom which was the best of all the locations in which we stayed during this vacation. The pool area was beautiful with all the flowers and fresh towels were always available at the pool.  The one negative comment is that this hotel has no elevator.  If you are carrying large luggage, it is difficult to manage the steps to the room.  There is also a Ralph's next door if you need any grocery items during the stay.  The room is a bit small, but clean. An easy walk to the beach.

Summary Heading: very nice room, great price and great location
Summary: We visited laguna beach end of march and were worried about the weather, but turned out 68 -70 degrees, beautiful! I have been to laguna before and stayed at surf and sand (very nice, but pricey). We didn't want to spend $400 a night this go around and the reviews of Holiday Inn Laguna Beach sounded pretty good. The rate was very good ($120/night in march) but to be honest we were leary that a holiday inn would not be so great and couldn't be that great at that rate. But we were pleasantly surprised. It is of course not the Ritz, but is a nice, almost boutique type hotel. You do have to keep your curtains mostly closed, but if your in your room in laguna beach during the day...you shouldn't be anyway! The rooms are nice, clean fresh smelling (i hate smoke). Summary: After carefully reading all of the reviews on this website, I decided to make at reservation at this hotel.  Everything about this hotel was better that expected.  We arrived in the middle of December and stayed for two nights.  We booked one of the suites that has an extra bedroom and my parents had a regular room.  The rooms were recently remodeled and they all had marble bathrooms.  Our suite was huge and it had the biggest bathroom that I have ever seen in a hotel along with a huge jaccuzzi.  As another review stated, the hotel is built around a beautiful courtyard with a great pool.  We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Unfortunately, this Holiday Inn did not have kids eat free.  The location was excellent, you just cross the street and walk up and there is the beach.

Summary: Traveling to CA for a family wedding, we stayed here for one night.  I have to say that the room was the nicest of any Holiday Inn I've ever stayed in.  Bathroom had beautiful marble/granite tile throughout and the shower had great water pressure.    As previously stated all rooms look out on the central courtyard (very Mediterranean-looking) which is where the pool is.  Nice but you do have to keep your curtains closed for privacy.  Flowers and palm trees are everywhere.  Parking in Laguna Beach is at a premium everywhere and they do charge $7 a nite to park a car, but other people I knew complained and had the fee waived.  24 hour grocery directly across the street and yes, it is really one block to the ocean. Summary Heading: We had a terrific time, close to everything!
Summary: My husband and I met our daughter and son-in-law (they are from Arizona) at the John Wayne airport September 10.  We were in California to attend a friends wedding on the 13th.  We stayed at the Holiday Inn Laguna 3 nights and we were very satisfied.  The accomidations were okay, sofa bed not known for their comfort!  The staff were helpful.  The location is GREAT, right across the street from a 24 hour grocery, 1 block from the ocean.  And shopping plus dining everywhere, whatever you could want!  Other friends from Minnesota also stayed here and loved it.  We will be back!

Summary: I arrived before official check-in time but the hotel was able to allocate a room without any problem. All rooms face onto a very nice courtyard with the swimming pool as the focal point. My room had been recently refurbished and was nicely appointed although a bit small. The hotel is a 5 minute walk into the centre of town, and there's a beach about a minute's walk away opposite.   The hotel's restaurant was still undergoing refurbishment and unlike most Holiday Inns there was no breakfast buffet, however the staff were friendly.

Summary: We spent the 4th of July here and were able to get the last room at the Holiday Inn booking about 6 weeks out.  The rooms all face into the pool, which is nice until you realize if you want any natural light in your room, you have to open the curtains facing the hallways where everyone walks by.  Room quality was OK.  Best part about the hotel was its good walking distance to pretty much everything in town.  Other than that, nothing to completely recommend it, but nothing to detract either.
